name: Peak Flow Capacity (Morphological Check) rapid curve

points.description: Observation: Bankfull width and depth closely match regional curves for the drainage area and slope. Bars and banks remain stable through ~1-2 yr flows. Criteria: Near regional curve; stable
Observation: Slightly oversized or undersized relative to curves. Isolated bank slumps after moderate events. Criteria: Mild departure; occasional instability
Observation: Noticeable mismatch to curves. Frequent bar growth or cutbank retreat after moderate events. Criteria: Significant departure; frequent instability
Observation: Highly out of family. Repeated blowouts, chute formation, or bank failures with moderate floods. Criteria: Severe departure; chronic instability
